revisions.rev:
[[File:Google Nexus.svg|thumb|Nexus Logo]] [[File:Galaxy Nexus smartphone.jpg|100px|thumb|[[Galaxy Nexus]], the latest in the Nexus series]] The '''Nexus''' is a series of [[Android (operating system)|Android]] smartphones produced by [[Google]] in co-operation with selected hardware companies. The purpose of the Nexus phones is to offer a "pure Android experience", in which the phones come free of carrier or manufacturer modifications and with an unlockable bootloader<ref>{{cite web|last=Bray |first=Tim |url=http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2010/12/its-not-rooting-its-openness.html |title=Android Developers Blog: Itâs not ârootingâ, itâs openness |publisher=Android-developers.blogspot.com |date=2010-12-20 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref> to allow for further development and end-user modification.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2011/11/03/galaxy-nexus-gets-rooted-forums-burst-into-applause/ |title=Galaxy Nexus gets rooted, forums burst into applause |publisher=Engadget |date=2011-11-03 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref> Nexus phones are considered the "flagship" Android devices.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://lifehacker.com/5707214/google-launches-android-23-gingerbread-and-nexus-s-flagship-phone |title=Google Launches Android 2.3 Gingerbread and Nexus S Flagship Phone |publisher=Lifehacker.com |date=2010-12-06 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=erica ho and brent rose |url=http://gizmodo.com/5851133/samsung-galaxy-nexus-the-greatest-androids-got-a-720p-super-amoled-display |title=This Is the Samsung Galaxy Nexus, Google's New Official Android Phone |publisher=Gizmodo.com |date=2011-10-18 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zdnet.com/blog/mobile-news/dont-diss-my-phone-nexus-s-to-get-ice-cream-sandwich-within-weeks/5214 |title=Donât diss my phone: Nexus S to get Ice Cream Sandwich within weeks |publisher=ZDNet |date=2011-10-27 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.engadget.com/2010/11/11/exclusive-samsung-flagship-phone-with-gingerbread-and-huge-di/ |title=Exclusive: Samsung 'flagship' phone with Gingerbread and huge display coming in early 2011 (update) |publisher=Engadget |date=2010-11-11 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Shanklin |first=Will |url=http://www.gottabemobile.com/2011/07/21/nexus-s-on-its-way-to-att-too-late-to-matter/ |title=Nexus S On Its Way to AT&T - Too Late to Matter? |publisher=Gottabemobile.com |date=2011-07-21 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref>
==HTC== *The [[Nexus One]] was manufactured by [[HTC Corporation|HTC]] and released in January 2010 as the first Nexus phone. It was released with [[Android_version_history#2.0/2.1_Eclair|Android 2.1 Eclair]], and was soon updated to be the first phone with [[Android_version_history#2.2.x_Froyo|Android 2.2 Froyo]].
==Samsung== *The [[Nexus S]], manufactured by [[Samsung]], was released in December 2010 to coincide with the release of [[Android version history#2.3.x Gingerbread|Android 2.3 Gingerbread]].
*The [[Galaxy Nexus]] is the latest Nexus phone. It was released in November 2011 (GSM Version, US at a yet to be determined date) to coincide with the release of [[Android version history|Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Today is Galaxy Nexus day in the UK |url=http://www.androidcentral.com/today-galaxy-nexus-day-uk-only-if-you-want-new-contract |title=Today is Galaxy Nexus day in the UK |publisher=Android Central |date=2011-11-17 |accessdate=2011-11-22}}</ref>
